meanings.definition: Make or become lighter in weight.
meanings.sent1: Carrying fewer books can lighten your backpack.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can help lighten the load on your muscles.
meanings.sent3: Trying to lift a feather can lighten your mood.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to lighten the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun rising over the mountains seemed to lighten the world around us.

meanings.definition: Make or become less serious or severe.
meanings.sent1: Watching a funny movie can lighten a tense situation.
meanings.sent2: His joke helped lighten the mood during a stressful meeting.
meanings.sent3: Adding a touch of humor can lighten a heavy conversation.
meanings.sent4: Her smile never failed to lighten the seriousness of the moment.
meanings.sent5: A good friend can always lighten the weight of your worries.

meanings.sent1: The streetlights help lighten the dark alley.
meanings.sent2: Candles can lighten a room during a power outage.
meanings.sent3: A flashlight can lighten your path in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The stars above seemed to lighten the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face seemed to lighten the entire room.
